msContents.summary: Fragment of a letter about a warrant for payment, mentioning the Arsinoe festival in Alexandria

msItem.note: Incomplete on the top and bottom; written along the fibers with 9 lines; the back is blank
One paragraphos; the different topics are separated by large blank spaces

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in December 1926; no. 44 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: - - - neither food payment nor wages. And before you sailed down to Alexandria for the Arsinoe festival you wrote me a warrant for payment so that (the allowance) for nine months was given us. Food allowance was also due for Thoth and Phaophi of the 35th year. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
